sponsor: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
briefTitle: Methylphenidate for Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder and Autism in Children
officialTitle: ADHD Symptoms in Autism: Cognition, Behavior, Treatment
summary: This study examined the cognitive and behavioral differences in children who have an autism spectrum disorder (ASD) with or without additional symptoms of ADHD. The study also examined the effectiveness of a range of doses of methylphenidate in improving cognitive and behavioral outcomes in children with both ASD and ADHD.

primaryOutcome.measure: Mean Conners' Teacher ADHD Index T Score by Dose
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Measured at each dosing week of the drug trial (placebo, low, medium, high)
